intro: Hieracium subglandulatum, commonly known as the glandular hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and can reach heights of up to 60 cm. Its leaves are hairy and often have glandular dots, which give it its scientific name. The flowers are yellow and bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
